Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water, showing it looking healthy and growing well.
The student can draw a plant without water, depicting it as wilted or not growing well.
The student can illustrate that plants need water to live and grow by comparing a healthy plant with a wilted plant in their drawing.
The student can draw patterns of plants needing water by showing these differences in their drawings.
